result.execSummary:
The defendant Paul M. Lhotka was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Incest, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 944.06.
  • Intimidate Victim/Dissuade Reporting, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.44(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
The Court will allow early discharge after 5 years if complies with all conditions of probation and upon application to the Court by Agent.

***Amended 3/20/18 to include restitution.  Paid in full.  Taken out of cash bond posted.  Costs also paid in full.

**Amended 3/20/18 to include restitution due.  Paid in full.  Taken out of cash bond posted.

Costs on Count 7 to be collected by Agent also.
**Amended 3/15/17 to include attorney fees.   Attorney fees paid in full.
***Amended 3/20/18 to indicate paid in full.  Taken out of cash bond posted.

Defendant to have no contact with any minors without the prior approval of his Agent.  (Exception is his own children)
Defendant shall have no contact with H.J.M. or any member of her family unless they consent in writing and approved by Agent.
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages without his Agent's approval.

Provide biological specimen to State Crime Lab for DNA analysis.
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.
Defendant shall participate in sex offender evaluation and follow sex offender recommendations arising therefrom.
Defendant shall comply with sex offender treatment for a period of 15 years.
